Package layers

Class MatrixOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • layers.MatrixOperations
  • public class MatrixOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple class defining some simple matrix operations such as matrix multiplication (dot-product) of two float[][] or two double[][[]
    Author:
    OdinhengeT
    See Also:
    LayerF, LayerD

      MatrixOperations()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static boolean areMatMultD​(double[][] m1, double[][] m2)
      Checks if the double[][] (double matrices) are dot multipliable (in the m1 * m2 order)
      static boolean areMatMultF​(float[][] m1, float[][] m2)
      Checks if the float[][] (float matrices) are dot multipliable (in the m1 * m2 order)
      static boolean areMatSameDimD​(double[][] m1, double[][] m2)
      Checks if two double[][] (or double matrices) are of the exact same shape
      static boolean areMatSameDimF​(float[][] m1, float[][] m2)
      Checks if two float[][] (or float matrices) are of the exact same shape
      static double[][] matMultD​(double[][] m1, double[][] m2)
      Multiplies m1 with m2 (in that order) if possible, throws IllegalArgumentException if not.
      static float[][] matMultF​(float[][] m1, float[][] m2)
      Multiplies m1 with m2 (in that order) if possible, throws IllegalArgumentException if not.

      • matMultF

        public static float[][] matMultF​(float[][] m1,
                                 float[][] m2)
        Multiplies m1 with m2 (in that order) if possible, throws IllegalArgumentException if not.
        Parameters:
        m1 - float[][] "matrix" number 1
        m2 - float[][] "matrix" number 2
        Returns:
        result of m1 * m2
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if m1 * m2 is not defined
